results.title: The White House
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Television, National Geographic Society and John B. Bredar
results.brief_description: In 1789 an idea forged by America’s first President, George Washington, received Congress approval. Washington’s aim was to build a new capital city and a President’s House away from New York on the river Potomac. Construction began in 1792 with the foundations being dug by slaves and half the workforce made up of immigrants. Built of iron and stone this magnificent building became a symbol of the American people and a symbol of power to the rest of the world. Unfortunately, George Washington died before the building was completed. This documentary takes you into the world of the White House and its day-to-day running, including the huge entourage of staff who serve the House - plumbers, electricians, maids and butlers, chefs and kitchen hands, event co-ordinators and managers. You will see a State Dinner being organised and prepared for 150 guests with the Russian President, Boris Yeltsin, as the distinguished State visitor, as well as rare shots of the living quarters where Presidents and their families have resided for over 200 years. Also includes historical footage, photographic stills and anecdotal stories from past Presidents, their families and employees at the White House. Narrated by Morgan Freeman. Contains some black and white footage.

results.title: The White frontier
results.brief_description: An account of the work of the British North Greenland Expedition, 1952, which set out to probe the secrets of the Greenland ice-cap. Shows the arrival of the Norwegian sealing vessel at the Expedition’s southern base at Britannia, and the setting out of the small group of explorers to establish observations posts 250 miles from the main camp.

results.title: The White cloud: the truck of Joe Madrid
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Anthony Loeb and Nicholas Clapp
results.brief_description: The first person narration in coloquial American spoken by Mexican-American truck driver, Joe Madrid, adds credibility and charm to this unpretentious work. His truck ferries perishable goods worth thousands of dollars across the continent. As he drives he talks about his work, truck and family.

results.title: The White cliffs of Dover
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sidney A. Franklin and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: This filmed interpretation of Alice Duer Miller’s poem features an all star cast of Irene Dunn, Roddy McDowall, Van Johnson, Dame May Whitty and C. Aubrey Smith. A young woman who moves from America to England with her father, meets and falls in love with Sir John Ashwood (Alan Marshal), an English baronet. They marry, and Susan soon falls pregnant, but tragically loses her husband to World War I before her son, John junior is born. Despite the prospect of isolation, she decides to remain in England (young son played by Roddy McDowall, adult son by Peter Lawford). Susan’s painful relationship with war and tragedy is relived years later when her son expresses a wish to go to war like his father. Reluctantly she agrees, as well as becoming a volunteer with the Red Cross. Once again, a mother’s love is placed in the hands of fate as the waiting game begins.

results.title: The White balloon
results.creator_credit: CMI, Dendy Films, Ferdos Films and Jafar Panahi
results.brief_description: This wonderful motion picture is the story of a young Iranian girl’s search for the perfect goldfish to release in her pond to encourage good luck in the New Year. However, when she loses the money her mother has given her, young Razieh and her brother seek their fortunes in modern day Tehran. This visually ravishing contemporary retelling of “The Red Balloon”, reveals much about the culture of the Muslim world. By filming through a child’s eyes, director Jafar Panahi reveals a world of incidental cruelty, a world which often rushes by too fast to listen to the desires of children. There is a darkness in “The White Balloon”, not explicit, but a sadness about the opportunities adults lose in understanding the world of their child. As in all the best fairy-tales, this is a profoundly humane story. The screenplay is by acclaimed director Abbas Kiarostami. Winner of the Camera D’Or at the 1995 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: The Whistle blower
results.creator_credit: Portreeve, Geoffrey Reeve and Simon Langton
results.brief_description: Nigel Havers plays a Russian linguist employed by an English spy centre to intercept and interpret KGB phone conversations. His father, portrayed by Michael Caine, is a conservative businessman and former intelligence officer whose faith in England is shattered after he uncovers the intricate web of deceit and cover-up employed by his country’s secret services. Following leads left by his son, he sets out to investigate the tactics and activities of the intelligence networks and the identity of the people they protect. Also stars James Fox, Felicity Deans, Sir John Gielgud, Kenneth Colley, Gordon Jackson, David Langton and Barry Foster. Screenplay by Julian Bond, based on the novel by John Hale. Photography by Fred Tammes. Edited by Robert Morgan. Music composed and conducted by John Scott, performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: The Whispering giant
results.brief_description: The story of the Bristol Britannia, Britain’s great hundred-seater, turbo-prop airliner, the first to operate a scheduled non-stop service across the Atlantic between London and New York. Ten years of specialised design and research went into the Britannia and the development of the aircraft from its inception in the planning offices of the Bristol Aeroplane Company. Shows the elaborate testing stages, test flights and the process of production; the proving flights and finally the actual operation of the Britannia by airlines in Britain, Canada, the USA and Mexico.

results.title: The Whispering chorus
results.creator_credit: Walker (Lasky) Artcraft and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Dissatisfied with his position in society, John Trimble heeds the dim image of Evil in his mind and embezzles some money; fakes his death and travels the world under an assumed name, becoming an opium addict in Hong Kong. His wife remarries a man who becomes the state governor. He returns home to see his dying mother and is arrested for his own murder under his assumed identity. Knowing that a public revelation of the truth would ruin his wife’s happiness, he listens to the whispering chorus of his conscience and allows himself to be executed. Cast includes Raymond Hatton, Kathlyn Williams, Elliott Dexter.

results.title: The Whipping boy
results.creator_credit: Gemini Films, Ellen Freyer and Syd Macartney
results.brief_description: Based on the Newberry Award winning novella by Sid Fleichman, ‘The Whipping boy’ tells the story of spoiled Prince Horace and Jemmy a streetwise orpan who is `conscripted’ into becoming the Prince’s whipping boy; a stand-in for the the Prince when he is to be punished. When the Prince’s pranks, designed to get his father’s attention, bring the country to the brink of war, he and Jemmy escape into the wide world and a series of adventures destined to change their lives.
